abstract: The News Corporation and Time Warner Cable were still haggling Thursday afternoon over a contract set to expire at midnight that allows for the retransmission of Fox’s stations.
snippet: The News Corporation and Time Warner Cable were still haggling Thursday afternoon over a contract set to expire at midnight that allows for the retransmission of Fox’s stations.
lead_paragraph: Update: 10:50 p.m.: Late Thursday evening, News Corporation and Time Warner Cable had not reached an agreement on new contract terms, a spokesman for Fox said, but the negotiations were continuing.

headline.main: Stalemate Continues in Cable Fee Dispute
